intro: Mentzelia albicaulis var. ctenophora, commonly known as the white stalked blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Loasaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
